intro: Brachyscome dimorphocarpa, commonly known as the double-headed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that resemble two dandelion heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the flowers bloom in spring and summer. Brachyscome dimorphocarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
